definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: All usage rights will be fully owned by our company.

sentences.english: The minor property house problems reflect the land use right of the Circulation.

sentences.english: Village leaders can arbitrarily "readjust" land rights at a moment's notice.

sentences.english: Who owns the group name in case of dispute?

sentences.english: And two teachers scuffled over whether they could share one of the half-dozen tables in the room.

sentences.english: The second part is the history of the construction of land-use rights to remise by auction.

sentences.english: The acquisition of housing land use right should be defined in details in legislation.

sentences.english: Land-use right to life is generally 70 years.

sentences.english: Ownership has been described as "the entirety of powers of use and disposal allowed by law".

sentences.english: When you run your tests, you can then use the weight to distribute your results.

definition: to have no right/to have no authority
